thinking: The first priority is to build a barracks so that I can train combat units. I will use the worker at (2,1) to build a barracks near my base.

The most important thing right now is to build a barracks so I can start training offensive units. I have enough resources at my base to build a barracks, so I need to find a worker and tell it to build a barracks near my base.
The current turn is 100. I have enough resources to build a barracks. I should use my worker to build a barracks near my base to start producing units.
The ally base has 5 resources. I need to build a barracks. I will assign the base to train a worker to get 1 worker, and then assign the worker to build a barracks near the base.

Okay, let's follow the suggested strategy. It's turn 200, so we should focus on building up our army and economy. I need to build a barracks so I can produce units. My base has 4 resources, and I need 5 to build a barracks, so first order of business is to harvest. Then build the barracks.
The ally base has 5 resources and one worker. I should build a barracks so I can start producing combat units. After the barracks is built, I should continue harvesting with the worker.

Okay, I need to build a barracks so I can train units. I have one worker that is currently producing a unit at (0,0), and another at (3,2). I will order the available worker to build a barracks near my base.
The ally base at (2, 1) should train a worker to increase resource collection, and the ally worker at (3, 2) should harvest resources from (0, 0) to increase resources for building a barracks.

Okay, let's follow the suggested strategy. It's turn 400, so we should be in the late game. I have one worker and one base. The worker is currently busy, so the base is the only unit that can act. I should focus on maintaining resource control and destroying enemy production buildings. Since I don't have a barracks, I need to build one first. I will use the base to train a worker.

Okay, I need to build a barracks so I can start producing combat units. I have one worker available at (3, 2), and I need to find a suitable location to build a barracks. Somewhere near my base would be ideal. I will check (3,3). I have 5 resources, and barracks cost 5, perfect. I will assign the worker to build a barracks.

Okay, it's turn 500. I need to focus on building my economy and army. I have a base, a barracks, and a worker. My base should be producing workers, my barracks should be producing units, and my worker should be harvesting. I need to prioritize building my economy and getting more resources to train units. The closest resource node is at (0,0). I also need to be producing units from my barracks. Heavies are a good choice because of their high HP and damage, but I should probably also get some lights for scouting and speed.

The enemy is still harassing my base with workers. I need to eliminate the enemy workers to slow down their economy and prevent them from building more structures. I will attack the closest enemy worker with my light units from the barracks. I will continue harvesting with my worker and train a heavy unit.

Okay, I need to follow the suggested strategy and focus on building my economy and developing my army. Since I already have a barracks, I should focus on training units and harvesting resources. I'll use my worker to harvest resources and my barracks to train a heavy unit.

Okay, it's turn 650, and I need to focus on eliminating the enemy. I have a worker, a base, and a barracks. The enemy has a base and several workers. Since I have a barracks, I should produce units and attack the enemy workers to slow their economy. Then I will focus on the enemy base.
The game is in the mid game, focus on training units from the barracks. Train heavy units to attack the enemy workers and buildings. Continue to harvest resources to maintain production.

Okay, it's turn 750. I have a base, a worker, and a barracks. I need to keep producing units and attacking the enemy. I have enough resources to train a heavy unit, and should continue harvesting. I should also build more combat units.

Okay, we need to build up our economy and start producing units. First, let's have the worker harvest resources. Then, we'll use the resources to build a barracks. After the barracks is built, we can begin training units.
The Barracks has been built. Now, train some units from the Barracks to attack the enemy.
Okay, we need to eliminate the enemy units and buildings. I will focus on training more units, and attacking the closest enemy workers.

The top priority is to keep the base alive. Given that there is a barracks already, and the base has very low HP, focus on killing the closest worker units to the base and producing more units. First, the worker will attack the nearest enemy worker to the base. Second, the barracks unit will train a heavy unit. Idle any other units.

The ally base has less than half HP. The ally base needs to be protected and the enemy base needs to be eliminated. The ally worker will harvest resources and the ally barracks will train a heavy unit.

The ally base is under attack, and its HP is dangerously low. The priority is to defend the base. The only available unit is the worker at (0, 1). It should attack the closest enemy worker. The barracks should start training a heavy unit to provide more defense.

The ally base is low on health, but producing workers is not helpful at this stage. The ally barracks is still alive and should be used to produce units. The enemy has a lot of workers, so the priority should be to kill them. Since the barracks is available, I will train a heavy unit.
Okay, it looks like we have a barracks and a worker. Let's get this worker harvesting and queue up some heavy units.

The ally base is critically low on health, so I will prioritize maintaining the base, while also harassing enemy workers to slow down their economy. Since the base can't move, it should remain idle. The worker should continue gathering resources. The barracks should continue to train units to harass the enemy.
The Ally base has very low HP. Barracks should train heavy to defend the base.

The ally base has very low HP and is under threat. The worker should attempt to collect resources to build a barracks for defence. The base should idle as it is low HP and the worker will collect resources for repairs next turn.
Okay, it's turn 1350, and I need to eliminate the enemy. My base is under attack. I should focus on defending it. I have one worker, so I will order it to attack the nearest enemy worker.

The ally base has less than 5 resources, so I will command it to produce a worker, which will harvest resources. This will help in building a barracks as soon as possible. After the barracks is built, I can start producing combat units.
